oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Building the flume line
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Building the flume line by the railroad.

Built by the Eastern Tennessee Power Company, the wooden Ocoee flume is the only one of its kind in the nation. Local residents worked on construction of the flume in the 1910s. In 1939, the Tennessee Valley Authority bought the powerhouses, dams and flume line.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Construction; Flumes; Hydraulic facilities; Hydroelectric power; Power industry; Railroads; Rivers
